Sequence Information.Target Organism: No MICs found in DRAMP database
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Has antimicrobial activity towards bacteria and fungi and exerts its antimicrobial activity probably via chelation of Zn2+ which is essential for microbial growth. Can induce cell death via autophagy and apoptosis and this occurs through the cross-talk of mitochondria and lysosomes via reactive oxygen species (ROS) and the process involves BNIP3. Can regulate neutrophil number and apoptosis by an anti-apoptotic effect.
Sequence Information.Miscellaneous: Binds two calcium ions per molecule with an affinity similar to that of the S100 proteins (By similarity).

Literature.Title: The 23-kilodalton protein, a substrate of protein kinase C, in bovine neutrophil cytosol is a member of the S100 family.
Literature.Author: Dianoux AC, Stasia MJ, Garin J, Gagnon J, Vignais PV.

Literature.Title: Nuclear proteins of the bovine esophageal epithelium. I. Monoclonal antibody W2 specifically reacts with condensed nuclei of differentiated superficial cells.
Literature.Author: Tang TK, Hong TM, Lin CY, Lai ML, Liu CH, Lo HJ, Wang ME, Chen LB, Chen WT, Ip W, et al.
